result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Prentiss Lamar Grafton Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Prentiss Lamar Grafton Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Prentiss Lamar Grafton Jr.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel is in trial in another court and requests an adjournment. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Prentiss Lamar Grafton in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Prentiss Lamar Grafton in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea hearing held.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2, 3, and 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Prentiss Lamar Grafton not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing. Court vacates the jury trial on 6/27/22 and converts the hearing to a plea hearing.  Defense requests to be heard as to bail at the next court date. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's AMENDED Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Prentiss Lamar Grafton not in court, in custody.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29. This hearing may be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Court ordered no contact with A.T.R
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Prentiss Lamar Grafton in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Prentiss Lamar Grafton in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prentiss Lamar Grafton appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
